raw_text:
Rapper Jay-Z becomes label boss
 
 Rap star Jay-Z is to become a record company executive after being put in charge of one of hip-hop's most influential labels, Def Jam.
 
 Jay-Z, who said he would make no more music after 2003's The Black Album, will become the company's president and chief executive from January. Def Jam's parent company, Universal, made the appointment after buying Jay-Z's Roc-A-Fella label. Def Jam's artists include LL Cool J, DMX, Ludacris, Ja Rule and Ashanti. Jay-Z will continue to run Roc-A-Fella, which he founded with Damon Dash in 1995 and has Kanye West and Beanie Sigel on its roster. Universal said on Wednesday it had bought the 50% of Roc-A-Fella it did not already own.
 
 Antonio "LA" Reid, chairman of The Island Def Jam Music Group, said: "I can think of no-one more relevant and credible in the hip-hop community to build upon Def Jam's fantastic legacy." He hoped Jay-Z would "move the company into its next groundbreaking era", he added. Jay-Z, real name Shawn Carter, said: "I have inherited two of the most important brands in hip-hop, Def Jam and Roc-A-Fella.
 
 "I feel this is a giant step for me and the entire artist community." One of the most successful and respected rap stars of the last eight years, Jay-Z's hits have included Hard Knock Life, Dirt Off Your Shoulder and 03 Bonnie and Clyde with his girlfriend Beyonce Knowles. He said he would retire after The Black Album, but has just released an album and been on an ill-fated tour with R Kelly. Def Jam was founded in 1984 by Russell Simmons and producer Rick Rubin and signed artists including Run-DMC, The Beastie Boys and Public Enemy.
llama3.2:1b: Jay-Z will become a record company executive after being appointed president and chief executive of Def Jam.
He will oversee the management of artists such as LL Cool J, DMX, Ludacris, Ja Rule, and Ashanti, in addition to his role with Roc-A-Fella, which he founded in 1995 with Damon Dash.

He will continue to run Roc-A-Fella, which he co-founded in 1995 with Damon Dash.
Jay-Z's appointment is seen as a step for the hip-hop community, and Antonio "LA" Reid hopes it will mark a new era for Def Jam.

tinyllama:1.1b: Rapper Jay-Z has been appointed as the president and chief executive of hip-hop label Def Jam, following in the footsteps of his rapper rival and long-time friend, Russell Simmons.
Jay-Z will now oversee the company that includes labels such as Roc-A-Fella Records and Def Jam Recordings.
The appointment was made by Universal Music Group (UMG), which bought a majority stake in the label last year.
Def Jam's roster of artists includes Jay-Z, who founded the company with Damon "Dame Dash" Dashawn in 1995.
The move marks the second time in two years that Jay-Z has moved into the role of record executive.
He previously served as chairman and CEO of Columbia Records from 2008 to 2009, before leaving to focus on his music career.
Jay-Z was also a successful solo artist with hit albums such as "The Blueprint," which debuted at No.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Jay-Z has been appointed as the new CEO of Def Jam Recordings by Universal Music Group.
This move will see Jay-Z take over from Antonio "LA" Reid who had been in charge since 1995.
With an impressive track record and a solid reputation in the industry, Jay-Z is expected to make significant changes to the company.
The new CEO has a clear vision for Def Jam: to continue building upon its legacy as one of hip-hop's most influential labels.
He plans to expand the company into new markets and develop innovative marketing strategies.
Jay-Z, whose real name is Shawn Carter, will oversee both Def Jam and Roc-A-Fella, which he co-founded with Damon Dash in 1995.
As well as building upon the success of Def Jam's roster, Jay-Z hopes to create his own "super brands" within hip-hop.
He has already hinted at this by naming Roc-A-Fella as his new parent company for the next 20 years.
This decision is part of a larger plan to reposition Def Jam as the leading force in hip-hop, following its acquisition by Universal in 2010.
Beyonce Knowles, Jay-Z's girlfriend and one of the most successful artists of all time, will also be making her mark on Def Jam, with an album due for release later this year.
